page.title: 18PAPER MILL TO HOME IN N.CAVE
page.content: We knocked and the door opened. Mrs. Judge said she had first come to live at the mill in 1976 but had owned it previously. She went on to talk about how the walls had been changed from wood to breeze blocks and the Yorkshire slide windows were renewed. Mostly the things are still original like the pantile roof. Inside you can tell as you move from the living to the old mill working area. When builders were widening the drive they dug up an old millstone now used as a washing line base. It must have been used for corn milling too. The mill has been renovated beautifully. Mrs. Judge said that the floor had to be black asphalt to prevent damp rising. She had rugs not fitted carpets. It all looked very nice.
